body_text:
use the following command to create a compressed archive and use it with feature "inline"

packfolder ui resources.rc -i ".html;.css;*.tis" -v "resources" -binary

When feature inline is not defined then use resource files from "src" directory.  this helps in testing the tis, css and html files.
Fixes #105. palfrey#1 demos it working. It's still pretty basic, but making it do more features will require other changes to the repo (or fiddly test setup)

#270 (comment)
morn-0@5164f76#commitcomment-58597904

This PR provide virtual display solution on Win10.
The related driver is RustDeskIddDriver.

Download prebuild driver or build the dirver your self.
Extract dirver files to the same directory of rustdesk.exe.
Read README.md in the dirver and run the demo. Make sure the environment is correct.
Click Install virtual display.

codec preference
linux compatible
Code optimization


check hwcodec config every time server or client start, but it is not checked when the tray icon started the service.
Simple function 'best' in hwcodec, always check hwcodec in another process.

correction 1.
When accessing the Korean version windows from the Mac, you cannot enter the Korean-English conversion key. The Microsoft Remote Desktop program uses the right Alt (option) key instead of the Korean-English conversion key. So, I modified it to work the same way.
correction 2.
When you click the mouse button in two places on the screen while pressing the Command key on the Mac, the mouse input will be incorrect. I modified it.

windows, linux, mac platform
reconnect manually after restart
enable restart default

Add UI Language Korean
Signed-off-by: kordood gigacms@gmail.com

Steps to reproduce: https://rustdesk.com/docs/en/dev/build/web
Detailed information about errors are provided in commit messages correspondingly.

It works abnormally when you connect to the window server and type shift + left arrow.
It's been modified.

Windows doesn't allow ":" in filenames, thats why connections to peers with the portnumer (:) dont remember the password nor appear in recent sessions.
PeerConfig files on *nix containing ":" will be renamed on the first run to stay backward compatible.
This fixes #1730

Hello,
I would like to add the catalan translation to rustdesk.
Thank you

Note:
Devs need to upgrade the local flutter engine with https://github.com/Kingtous/engine/releases/tag/v3.0.5-rustdesk.2

Most of the implementation code was taken from the H-M-H/Weylus. While it appears that there may be a licensing conflict, according to a previous response from the maintainer, it seems that there are no problems with using the code, so I used it. #56 (comment)
also please note that I have not used Rust before, so the code may be incorrect. However, when I tested and ran it, there were no issues. I apologize for the inconvenience, but please check the code again before merging. Thank you.

This PR corrects misspellings identified by the check-spelling action.
The misspellings have been reported at https://github.com/jsoref/rustdesk/actions/runs/3876807141#summary-10533316862
The action reports that the changes in this PR would make it happy: https://github.com/jsoref/rustdesk/actions/runs/3876807271#summary-10533317071
Note: this PR does not include the action. If you're interested in running a spell check on every PR and push, that can be offered separately.

Code edited to allow the setting of a custom server with env variables

RENDEZVOUS_SERVER1
RENDEZVOUS_SERVER2
RENDEZVOUS_SERVER3

Allows editing custom key with

RS_PUB_KEY_VAL


Workflows updated to support adding these custom env variables via secrets.


Workflows updated to allow ignoring key signing if specific secrets are set.


Interface file checks hbb_common::config::RS_PUB_KEY to decide if to display "run your own server" message rather then the existence of custom-rendezvous-server


Added flutter-custom-build.yml so that people can use github workflows to generate there own files using github actions

Allow direct connect to {hostname}:{port}
Like the direct access by ip, it will now check the peer string with regex, and treat it as {hostname}:{port} if matched.
PS: Current regex is: ^[\-.0-9a-zA-Z]+:\d{1,5}$
This PR should fix #2847 and #126
